definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: The trees bent before the strong wind.
268:The villagers were planting trees to protect the crops from the strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 爲保護莊稼免受強風侵害，村民在植樹。

sentences.english: In this paper, we set forth the application of grouting in complete strong weathering rock body to the new grouting plug, its structure and working principle.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹全強風化巖體中灌漿時應用的新型灌漿栓塞。

sentences.english: In strong wind, let someone grab your leading edge from the center.
sentences.chinese: 強風時，請人幫忙抓住傘中央前緣風口處。

sentences.english: As the strong winds gusted against the kites, a string kept them in check.
sentences.chinese: 當強風把風箏吹起，牽引線就能夠控制它們。

sentences.english: Hard wind and wizen his face.
sentences.chinese: 強風與酷寒使他的臉孔皺縮了。

sentences.english: When the load was in transit in the mid-air, a strong wind caused it to swing sideways.
sentences.chinese: 當負載運送到半空，強風引致負載向一邊搖擺。

sentences.english: The sails bellied out in the strong breeze.
sentences.chinese: 帆在強風中鼓得滿滿的。

sentences.english: Fierce wind and snow hounded the flight as the plane trekked through the Andes mountains.
sentences.chinese: 飛機行至安第斯山脈上空時遭遇強風和降雪。

sentences.english: High winds whipping across the northeast toppled this tractor-trailer Monday.
sentences.chinese: 週一，在美國東北部，強風把一輛大貨車吹倒在地。

sentences.english: A sudden strong wind capsize their boat.
sentences.chinese: 突然一陣強風弄翻了他們的船。

sentences.english: A strong wind started to below.
Hurricane-force winds extended 70 miles from the eye.
sentences.chinese: 颶風強風從眼睛延長70英里。

sentences.english: Wind setdowns are a result of a strong wind that never seems to stop.
sentences.chinese: 風降是由一股持續不斷的強風引起的。

sentences.english: Typhoon usually bring heavy rain and strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 颱風通常帶來豪雨和強風。

definition: day after day/for several days running
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
